places.name: Great Wall of China
places.description: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials.

places.name: Machu Picchu
places.description: Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inca citadel located in the Eastern Cordillera of southern Peru.

places.name: Pyramids of Giza
places.description: The Pyramids of Giza are ancient pyramid structures located in Giza, Egypt.

places.name: Taj Mahal
places.description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.

places.name: Colosseum
places.description: The Colosseum is an oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy.

places.name: Eiffel Tower
places.description: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.

places.name: Statue of Liberty
places.description: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor.

places.name: Christ the Redeemer
places.description: Christ the Redeemer is an Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

places.name: Angkor Wat
places.description: Angkor Wat is a temple complex in Cambodia and the largest religious monument in the world.

places.name: Sydney Opera House
places.description: The Sydney Opera House is a multi-venue performing arts centre in Sydney, Australia.

places.name: Mount Everest
places.description: Mount Everest is Earth's highest mountain above sea level, located in the Himalayas.

places.name: Petra
places.description: Petra is a historical and archaeological city in southern Jordan famous for its rock-cut architecture.
